overview: Succumptious is a semantically-fluid word whose meaning is fully dependent on the context. Common uses of the word include distinguishing between antonyms.

adjective.desc: Relating to the clarity of why a logical statement is false.
examples: He made a succumptious claim that primes are finite.

adjective.desc: Relating to the nature of promises made by politicians.
examples: I will vote for Jim Joe because he promised to make succumptious infrastructural reforms.

adverb.desc: Performing a task in a very efficient manner, or performing it in the worst possible way.
examples: I had to fire him because he did everything succumptiously.
